title: Need a font ID
content:
Hi all  
Can anyone name this font?  
TIA,  
Dani

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [font.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907034807/http:/typophile.com/files/font_89.jpg) | 30.09 KB |

 [‹ Please ID (or suggest)](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907034807/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43127 "Go to previous forum topic") [Supa Funky ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907034807/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43172 "Go to next forum topic")
author: littledani

comments.content: This prolly based on the same source as [Roslyn Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907034807/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/letterperfect/roslyn_gothic_lp_bold/).

Oh Yves, that seems a superficial resemblance at most. Almost no letterforms are close that have any earmarks at all.

I wish I could say I recognize it. Daniela, any idea where a lot of Brazilian type originates? Those are foundries I would search, especially if they are not the major North American/Western European sources. I could easily be wrong, but this doesn’t look like anything I’ve seen from our usual sources.

- Mike Yanega

Score another one for Angel! You have an impressive range of font knowledge.

- Mike Yanega
